6// RewriteRowMajorMatrices: Rewrite row-major matrices as column-major.
7//
8
9#include "compiler/translator/tree_ops/RewriteRowMajorMatrices.h"
10
11#include "compiler/translator/Compiler.h"
12#include "compiler/translator/ImmutableStringBuilder.h"
13#include "compiler/translator/StaticType.h"
14#include "compiler/translator/SymbolTable.h"
15#include "compiler/translator/tree_util/IntermNode_util.h"
16#include "compiler/translator/tree_util/IntermTraverse.h"
17#include "compiler/translator/tree_util/ReplaceVariable.h"
18
19namespace sh
20{
21namespace
22{
23// Only structs with matrices are tracked. If layout(row_major) is applied to a struct that doesn't
24// have matrices, it's silently dropped. This is also used to avoid creating duplicates for inner
25// structs that don't have matrices.
26struct StructConversionData
27{
28 // The converted struct with every matrix transposed.
29 TStructure *convertedStruct = nullptr;
30
31 // The copy-from and copy-to functions copying from a struct to its converted version and back.
32 TFunction *copyFromOriginal = nullptr;
33 TFunction *copyToOriginal = nullptr;
34};
35
36bool DoesFieldContainRowMajorMatrix(const TField *field, bool isBlockRowMajor)
37{
38 TLayoutMatrixPacking matrixPacking = field->type()->getLayoutQualifier().matrixPacking;
39
40 // The field is row major if either explicitly specified as such, or if it inherits it from the
41 // block layout qualifier.
42 if (matrixPacking == EmpColumnMajor || (matrixPacking == EmpUnspecified && !isBlockRowMajor))
43 {
44 return false;
45 }
46
47 // The field is qualified with row_major, but if it's not a matrix or a struct containing
48 // matrices, that's a useless qualifier.
49 const TType *type = field->type();
50 return type->isMatrix() || type->isStructureContainingMatrices();
51}
52
53TField *DuplicateField(const TField *field)
54{
55 return new TField(new TType(*field->type()), field->name(), field->line(), field->symbolType());
56}
57
58void SetColumnMajor(TType *type)
59{
60 TLayoutQualifier layoutQualifier = type->getLayoutQualifier();
61 layoutQualifier.matrixPacking = EmpColumnMajor;
62 type->setLayoutQualifier(layoutQualifier);
63}
64
65TType *TransposeMatrixType(const TType *type)
66{
67 TType *newType = new TType(*type);
68
69 SetColumnMajor(newType);
70
71 newType->setPrimarySize(static_cast<unsigned char>(type->getRows()));
72 newType->setSecondarySize(static_cast<unsigned char>(type->getCols()));
73
74 return newType;
75}
76
77void CopyArraySizes(const TType *from, TType *to)
78{
79 if (from->isArray())
80 {
81 to->makeArrays(from->getArraySizes());
82 }
83}
84
85// Determine if the node is an index node (array index or struct field selection). For the purposes
86// of this transformation, swizzle nodes are considered index nodes too.
87bool IsIndexNode(TIntermNode *node, TIntermNode *child)
88{
89 if (node->getAsSwizzleNode())
90 {
91 return true;
92 }
93
94 TIntermBinary *binaryNode = node->getAsBinaryNode();
95 if (binaryNode == nullptr || child != binaryNode->getLeft())
96 {
97 return false;
98 }
99
100 TOperator op = binaryNode->getOp();
101
102 return op == EOpIndexDirect || op == EOpIndexDirectInterfaceBlock ||
103 op == EOpIndexDirectStruct || op == EOpIndexIndirect;
104}
105
106TIntermSymbol *CopyToTempVariable(TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
107 TIntermTyped *node,
108 TIntermSequence *prependStatements)
109{
110 TVariable *temp = CreateTempVariable(symbolTable, &node->getType());
111 TIntermDeclaration *tempDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(temp, node);
112 prependStatements->push_back(tempDecl);
113
114 return new TIntermSymbol(temp);
115}
116
117TIntermAggregate *CreateStructCopyCall(const TFunction *copyFunc, TIntermTyped *expression)
118{
119 return TIntermAggregate::CreateFunctionCall(*copyFunc, new TIntermSequence({expression}));
120}
121
122TIntermTyped *CreateTransposeCall(TSymbolTable *symbolTable, TIntermTyped *expression)
123{
124 return CreateBuiltInFunctionCallNode("transpose", new TIntermSequence({expression}),
125 *symbolTable, 300);
126}
127
128TOperator GetIndex(TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
129 TIntermNode *node,
130 TIntermSequence *indices,
131 TIntermSequence *prependStatements)
132{
133 // Swizzle nodes are converted EOpIndexDirect for simplicity, with one index per swizzle
134 // channel.
135 TIntermSwizzle *asSwizzle = node->getAsSwizzleNode();
136 if (asSwizzle)
137 {
138 for (int channel : asSwizzle->getSwizzleOffsets())
139 {
140 indices->push_back(CreateIndexNode(channel));
141 }
142 return EOpIndexDirect;
143 }
144
145 TIntermBinary *binaryNode = node->getAsBinaryNode();
146 ASSERT(binaryNode);
147
148 TOperator op = binaryNode->getOp();
149 ASSERT(op == EOpIndexDirect || op == EOpIndexDirectInterfaceBlock ||
150 op == EOpIndexDirectStruct || op == EOpIndexIndirect);
151
152 TIntermTyped *rhs = binaryNode->getRight()->deepCopy();
153 if (rhs->getAsConstantUnion() == nullptr)
154 {
155 rhs = CopyToTempVariable(symbolTable, rhs, prependStatements);
156 }
157
158 indices->push_back(rhs);
159 return op;
160}
161
162TIntermTyped *ReplicateIndexNode(TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
163 TIntermNode *node,
164 TIntermTyped *lhs,
165 TIntermSequence *indices)
166{
167 TIntermSwizzle *asSwizzle = node->getAsSwizzleNode();
168 if (asSwizzle)
169 {
170 return new TIntermSwizzle(lhs, asSwizzle->getSwizzleOffsets());
171 }
172
173 TIntermBinary *binaryNode = node->getAsBinaryNode();
174 ASSERT(binaryNode);
175
176 ASSERT(indices->size() == 1);
177 TIntermTyped *rhs = indices->front()->getAsTyped();
178
179 return new TIntermBinary(binaryNode->getOp(), lhs, rhs);
180}
181
182TOperator GetIndexOp(TIntermNode *node)
183{
184 return node->getAsConstantUnion() ? EOpIndexDirect : EOpIndexIndirect;
185}
186
187bool IsConvertedField(TIntermTyped *indexNode,
188 const angle::HashMap<const TField *, bool> &convertedFields)
189{
190 TIntermBinary *asBinary = indexNode->getAsBinaryNode();
191 if (asBinary == nullptr)
192 {
193 return false;
194 }
195
196 if (asBinary->getOp() != EOpIndexDirectInterfaceBlock)
197 {
198 return false;
199 }
200
201 const TInterfaceBlock *interfaceBlock = asBinary->getLeft()->getType().getInterfaceBlock();
202 ASSERT(interfaceBlock);
203
204 TIntermConstantUnion *fieldIndexNode = asBinary->getRight()->getAsConstantUnion();
205 ASSERT(fieldIndexNode);
206 ASSERT(fieldIndexNode->getConstantValue() != nullptr);
207
208 int fieldIndex = fieldIndexNode->getConstantValue()->getIConst();
209 const TField *field = interfaceBlock->fields()[fieldIndex];
210
211 return convertedFields.count(field) > 0 && convertedFields.at(field);
212}
213
214// A helper class to transform expressions of array type. Iterates over every element of the
215// array.
216class TransformArrayHelper
217{
218 public:
219 TransformArrayHelper(TIntermTyped *baseExpression)
220 : mBaseExpression(baseExpression),
221 mBaseExpressionType(baseExpression->getType()),
222 mArrayIndices(mBaseExpressionType.getArraySizes().size(), 0)
223 {}
224
225 TIntermTyped *getNextElement(TIntermTyped *valueExpression, TIntermTyped **valueElementOut)
226 {
227 const TSpan<const unsigned int> &arraySizes = mBaseExpressionType.getArraySizes();
228
229 // If the last index overflows, element enumeration is done.
230 if (mArrayIndices.back() >= arraySizes.back())
231 {
232 return nullptr;
233 }
234
235 TIntermTyped *element = getCurrentElement(mBaseExpression);
236 if (valueExpression)
237 {
238 *valueElementOut = getCurrentElement(valueExpression);
239 }
240
241 incrementIndices(arraySizes);
242 return element;
243 }
244
245 void accumulateForRead(TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
246 TIntermTyped *transformedElement,
247 TIntermSequence *prependStatements)
248 {
249 TIntermTyped *temp = CopyToTempVariable(symbolTable, transformedElement, prependStatements);
250 mReadTransformConstructorArgs.push_back(temp);
251 }
252
253 TIntermTyped *constructReadTransformExpression()
254 {
255 const TSpan<const unsigned int> &baseTypeArraySizes = mBaseExpressionType.getArraySizes();
256 TVector<unsigned int> arraySizes(baseTypeArraySizes.begin(), baseTypeArraySizes.end());
257 TIntermTyped *firstElement = mReadTransformConstructorArgs.front()->getAsTyped();
258 const TType &baseType = firstElement->getType();
259
260 // If N dimensions, acc[0] == size[0] and acc[i] == size[i] * acc[i-1].
261 // The last value is unused, and is not present.
262 TVector<unsigned int> accumulatedArraySizes(arraySizes.size() - 1);
263
264 if (accumulatedArraySizes.size() > 0)
265 {
266 accumulatedArraySizes[0] = arraySizes[0];
267 }
268 for (size_t index = 1; index + 1 < arraySizes.size(); ++index)
269 {
270 accumulatedArraySizes[index] = accumulatedArraySizes[index - 1] * arraySizes[index];
271 }
272
273 return constructReadTransformExpressionHelper(arraySizes, accumulatedArraySizes, baseType,
274 0);
275 }
276
277 private:
278 TIntermTyped *getCurrentElement(TIntermTyped *expression)
279 {
280 TIntermTyped *element = expression->deepCopy();
281 for (auto it = mArrayIndices.rbegin(); it != mArrayIndices.rend(); ++it)
282 {
283 unsigned int index = *it;
284 element = new TIntermBinary(EOpIndexDirect, element, CreateIndexNode(index));
285 }
286 return element;
287 }
288
289 void incrementIndices(const TSpan<const unsigned int> &arraySizes)
290 {
291 // Assume mArrayIndices is an N digit number, where digit i is in the range
292 // [0, arraySizes[i]). This function increments this number. Last digit is the most
293 // significant digit.
294 for (size_t digitIndex = 0; digitIndex < arraySizes.size(); ++digitIndex)
295 {
296 ++mArrayIndices[digitIndex];
297 if (mArrayIndices[digitIndex] < arraySizes[digitIndex])
298 {
299 break;
300 }
301 if (digitIndex + 1 != arraySizes.size())
302 {
303 // This digit has now overflown and is reset to 0, carry will be added to the next
304 // digit. The most significant digit will keep the overflow though, to make it
305 // clear we have exhausted the range.
306 mArrayIndices[digitIndex] = 0;
307 }
308 }
309 }
310
311 TIntermTyped *constructReadTransformExpressionHelper(
312 const TVector<unsigned int> &arraySizes,
313 const TVector<unsigned int> &accumulatedArraySizes,
314 const TType &baseType,
315 size_t elementsOffset)
316 {
317 ASSERT(!arraySizes.empty());
318
319 TType *transformedType = new TType(baseType);
320 transformedType->makeArrays(arraySizes);
321
322 // If one dimensional, create the constructor with the given elements.
323 if (arraySizes.size() == 1)
324 {
325 ASSERT(accumulatedArraySizes.size() == 0);
326
327 auto sliceStart = mReadTransformConstructorArgs.begin() + elementsOffset;
328 TIntermSequence slice(sliceStart, sliceStart + arraySizes[0]);
329
330 return TIntermAggregate::CreateConstructor(*transformedType, &slice);
331 }
332
333 // If not, create constructors for every column recursively.
334 TVector<unsigned int> subArraySizes(arraySizes.begin(), arraySizes.end() - 1);
335 TVector<unsigned int> subArrayAccumulatedSizes(accumulatedArraySizes.begin(),
336 accumulatedArraySizes.end() - 1);
337
338 TIntermSequence constructorArgs;
339 unsigned int colStride = accumulatedArraySizes.back();
340 for (size_t col = 0; col < arraySizes.back(); ++col)
341 {
342 size_t colElementsOffset = elementsOffset + col * colStride;
343
344 constructorArgs.push_back(constructReadTransformExpressionHelper(
345 subArraySizes, subArrayAccumulatedSizes, baseType, colElementsOffset));
346 }
347
348 return TIntermAggregate::CreateConstructor(*transformedType, &constructorArgs);
349 }
350
351 TIntermTyped *mBaseExpression;
352 const TType &mBaseExpressionType;
353 TVector<unsigned int> mArrayIndices;
354
355 TIntermSequence mReadTransformConstructorArgs;
356};
357
358// Traverser that:
359//
360// 1. Converts |layout(row_major) matCxR M| to |layout(column_major) matRxC Mt|.
361// 2. Converts |layout(row_major) S s| to |layout(column_major) St st|, where S is a struct that
362// contains matrices, and St is a new struct with the transformation in 1 applied to matrix
363// members (recursively).
364// 3. When read from, the following transformations are applied:
365//
366// M -> transpose(Mt)
367// M[c] -> gvecN(Mt[0][c], Mt[1][c], ..., Mt[N-1][c])
368// M[c][r] -> Mt[r][c]
369// M[c].yz -> gvec2(Mt[1][c], Mt[2][c])
370// MArr -> MType[D1]..[DN](transpose(MtArr[0]...[0]), ...)
371// s -> copy_St_to_S(st)
372// sArr -> SType[D1]...[DN](copy_St_to_S(stArr[0]..[0]), ...)
373// (matrix reads through struct are transformed similarly to M)
374//
375// 4. When written to, the following transformations are applied:
376//
377// M = exp -> Mt = transpose(exp)
378// M[c] = exp -> temp = exp
379// Mt[0][c] = temp[0]
380// Mt[1][c] = temp[1]
381// ...
382// Mt[N-1][c] = temp[N-1]
383// M[c][r] = exp -> Mt[r][c] = exp
384// M[c].yz = exp -> temp = exp
385// Mt[1][c] = temp[0]
386// Mt[2][c] = temp[1]
387// MArr = exp -> temp = exp
388// Mt = MtType[D1]..[DN](temp([0]...[0]), ...)
389// s = exp -> st = copy_S_to_St(exp)
390// sArr = exp -> temp = exp
391// St = StType[D1]...[DN](copy_S_to_St(temp[0]..[0]), ...)
392// (matrix writes through struct are transformed similarly to M)
393//
394// 5. If any of the above is passed to an `inout` parameter, both transformations are applied:
395//
396// f(M[c]) -> temp = gvecN(Mt[0][c], Mt[1][c], ..., Mt[N-1][c])
397// f(temp)
398// Mt[0][c] = temp[0]
399// Mt[1][c] = temp[1]
400// ...
401// Mt[N-1][c] = temp[N-1]
402//
403// f(s) -> temp = copy_St_to_S(st)
404// f(temp)
405// st = copy_S_to_St(temp)
406//
407// If passed to an `out` parameter, the `temp` parameter is simply not initialized.
408//
409// 6. If the expression leading to the matrix or struct has array subscripts, temp values are
410// created for them to avoid duplicating side effects.
411//
412class RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser : public TIntermTraverser
413{
414 public:
415 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser(TCompiler *compiler, TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
416 : TIntermTraverser(true, true, true, symbolTable),
417 mCompiler(compiler),
418 mStructMapOut(&mOuterPass.structMap),
419 mInterfaceBlockMap(&mOuterPass.interfaceBlockMap),
420 mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn(mOuterPass.interfaceBlockFieldConverted),
421 mCopyFunctionDefinitionsOut(&mOuterPass.copyFunctionDefinitions),
422 mOuterTraverser(nullptr),
423 mInnerPassRoot(nullptr),
424 mIsProcessingInnerPassSubtree(false)
425 {}
426
427 bool visitDeclaration(Visit visit, TIntermDeclaration *node) override
428 {
429 // No need to process declarations in inner passes.
430 if (mInnerPassRoot != nullptr)
431 {
432 return true;
433 }
434
435 if (visit != PreVisit)
436 {
437 return true;
438 }
439
440 const TIntermSequence &sequence = *(node->getSequence());
441
442 TIntermTyped *variable = sequence.front()->getAsTyped();
443 const TType &type = variable->getType();
444
445 // If it's a struct declaration that has matrices, remember it. If a row-major instance
446 // of it is created, it will have to be converted.
447 if (type.isStructSpecifier() && type.isStructureContainingMatrices())
448 {
449 const TStructure *structure = type.getStruct();
450 ASSERT(structure);
451
452 ASSERT(mOuterPass.structMap.count(structure) == 0);
453
454 StructConversionData structData;
455 mOuterPass.structMap[structure] = structData;
456
457 return false;
458 }
459
460 // If it's an interface block, it may have to be converted if it contains any row-major
461 // fields.
462 if (type.isInterfaceBlock() && type.getInterfaceBlock()->containsMatrices())
463 {
464 const TInterfaceBlock *block = type.getInterfaceBlock();
465 ASSERT(block);
466 bool isBlockRowMajor = type.getLayoutQualifier().matrixPacking == EmpRowMajor;
467
468 const TFieldList &fields = block->fields();
469 bool anyRowMajor = isBlockRowMajor;
470
471 for (const TField *field : fields)
472 {
473 if (DoesFieldContainRowMajorMatrix(field, isBlockRowMajor))
474 {
475 anyRowMajor = true;
476 break;
477 }
478 }
479
480 if (anyRowMajor)
481 {
482 convertInterfaceBlock(node);
483 }
484
485 return false;
486 }
487
488 return true;
489 }
490
491 void visitSymbol(TIntermSymbol *symbol) override
492 {
493 // If in inner pass, only process if the symbol is under that root.
494 if (mInnerPassRoot != nullptr && !mIsProcessingInnerPassSubtree)
495 {
496 return;
497 }
498
499 const TVariable *variable = &symbol->variable();
500 bool needsRewrite = mInterfaceBlockMap->count(variable) != 0;
501
502 // If it's a field of a nameless interface block, it may still need conversion.
503 if (!needsRewrite)
504 {
505 // Nameless interface block field symbols have the interface block pointer set, but are
506 // not interface blocks.
507 if (symbol->getType().getInterfaceBlock() && !variable->getType().isInterfaceBlock())
508 {
509 needsRewrite = convertNamelessInterfaceBlockField(symbol);
510 }
511 }
512
513 if (needsRewrite)
514 {
515 transformExpression(symbol);
516 }
517 }
518
519 bool visitBinary(Visit visit, TIntermBinary *node) override
520 {
521 if (node == mInnerPassRoot)
522 {
523 // We only want to process the right-hand side of an assignment in inner passes. When
524 // visit is InVisit, the left-hand side is already processed, and the right-hand side is
525 // next. Set a flag to mark this duration.
526 mIsProcessingInnerPassSubtree = visit == InVisit;
527 }
528
529 return true;
530 }
531
532 TIntermSequence *getStructCopyFunctions() { return &mOuterPass.copyFunctionDefinitions; }
533
534 private:
535 typedef angle::HashMap<const TStructure *, StructConversionData> StructMap;
536 typedef angle::HashMap<const TVariable *, TVariable *> InterfaceBlockMap;
537 typedef angle::HashMap<const TField *, bool> InterfaceBlockFieldConverted;
538
539 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser(
540 TSymbolTable *symbolTable,
541 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser *outerTraverser,
542 InterfaceBlockMap *interfaceBlockMap,
543 const InterfaceBlockFieldConverted &interfaceBlockFieldConverted,
544 StructMap *structMap,
545 TIntermSequence *copyFunctionDefinitions,
546 TIntermBinary *innerPassRoot)
547 : TIntermTraverser(true, true, true, symbolTable),
548 mStructMapOut(structMap),
549 mInterfaceBlockMap(interfaceBlockMap),
550 mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn(interfaceBlockFieldConverted),
551 mCopyFunctionDefinitionsOut(copyFunctionDefinitions),
552 mOuterTraverser(outerTraverser),
553 mInnerPassRoot(innerPassRoot),
554 mIsProcessingInnerPassSubtree(false)
555 {}
556
557 void convertInterfaceBlock(TIntermDeclaration *node)
558 {
559 ASSERT(mInnerPassRoot == nullptr);
560
561 const TIntermSequence &sequence = *(node->getSequence());
562
563 TIntermTyped *variableNode = sequence.front()->getAsTyped();
564 const TType &type = variableNode->getType();
565 const TInterfaceBlock *block = type.getInterfaceBlock();
566 ASSERT(block);
567
568 bool isBlockRowMajor = type.getLayoutQualifier().matrixPacking == EmpRowMajor;
569
570 // Recreate the struct with its row-major fields converted to column-major equivalents.
571 TIntermSequence newDeclarations;
572
573 TFieldList *newFields = new TFieldList;
574 for (const TField *field : block->fields())
575 {
576 TField *newField = nullptr;
577
578 if (DoesFieldContainRowMajorMatrix(field, isBlockRowMajor))
579 {
580 newField = convertField(field, &newDeclarations);
581
582 // Remember that this field was converted.
583 mOuterPass.interfaceBlockFieldConverted[field] = true;
584 }
585 else
586 {
587 newField = DuplicateField(field);
588 }
589
590 newFields->push_back(newField);
591 }
592
593 // Create a new interface block with these fields.
594 TLayoutQualifier blockLayoutQualifier = type.getLayoutQualifier();
595 blockLayoutQualifier.matrixPacking = EmpColumnMajor;
596
597 TInterfaceBlock *newInterfaceBlock =
598 new TInterfaceBlock(mSymbolTable, block->name(), newFields, blockLayoutQualifier,
599 block->symbolType(), block->extension());
600
601 // Create a new declaration with the new type. Declarations are separated at this point,
602 // so there should be only one variable here.
603 ASSERT(sequence.size() == 1);
604
605 TType *newInterfaceBlockType =
606 new TType(newInterfaceBlock, type.getQualifier(), blockLayoutQualifier);
607
608 TIntermDeclaration *newDeclaration = new TIntermDeclaration;
609 const TVariable *variable = &variableNode->getAsSymbolNode()->variable();
610
611 const TType *newType = newInterfaceBlockType;
612 if (type.isArray())
613 {
614 TType *newArrayType = new TType(*newType);
615 CopyArraySizes(&type, newArrayType);
616 newType = newArrayType;
617 }
618
619 // If the interface block variable itself is temp, use an empty name.
620 bool variableIsTemp = variable->symbolType() == SymbolType::Empty;
621 const ImmutableString &variableName =
622 variableIsTemp ? kEmptyImmutableString : variable->name();
623
624 TVariable *newVariable = new TVariable(mSymbolTable, variableName, newType,
625 variable->symbolType(), variable->extension());
626
627 newDeclaration->appendDeclarator(new TIntermSymbol(newVariable));
628
629 mOuterPass.interfaceBlockMap[variable] = newVariable;
630
631 newDeclarations.push_back(newDeclaration);
632
633 // Replace the interface block definition with the new one, prepending any new struct
634 // definitions.
635 mMultiReplacements.emplace_back(getParentNode()->getAsBlock(), node, newDeclarations);
636 }
637
638 bool convertNamelessInterfaceBlockField(TIntermSymbol *symbol)
639 {
640 const TVariable *variable = &symbol->variable();
641 const TInterfaceBlock *interfaceBlock = symbol->getType().getInterfaceBlock();
642
643 // Find the variable corresponding to this interface block. If the interface block
644 // is not rewritten, or this refers to a field that is not rewritten, there's
645 // nothing to do.
646 for (auto iter : *mInterfaceBlockMap)
647 {
648 // Skip other rewritten nameless interface block fields.
649 if (!iter.first->getType().isInterfaceBlock())
650 {
651 continue;
652 }
653
654 // Skip if this is not a field of this rewritten interface block.
655 if (iter.first->getType().getInterfaceBlock() != interfaceBlock)
656 {
657 continue;
658 }
659
660 const ImmutableString symbolName = symbol->getName();
661
662 // Find which field it is
663 const TVector<TField *> fields = interfaceBlock->fields();
664 for (size_t fieldIndex = 0; fieldIndex < fields.size(); ++fieldIndex)
665 {
666 const TField *field = fields[fieldIndex];
667 if (field->name() != symbolName)
668 {
669 continue;
670 }
671
672 // If this field doesn't need a rewrite, there's nothing to do.
673 if (mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn.count(field) == 0 ||
674 !mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn.at(field))
675 {
676 break;
677 }
678
679 // Create a new variable that references the replaced interface block.
680 TType *newType = new TType(variable->getType());
681 newType->setInterfaceBlock(iter.second->getType().getInterfaceBlock());
682
683 TVariable *newVariable =
684 new TVariable(mSymbolTable, variable->name(), newType, variable->symbolType(),
685 variable->extension());
686
687 (*mInterfaceBlockMap)[variable] = newVariable;
688
689 return true;
690 }
691
692 break;
693 }
694
695 return false;
696 }
697
698 void convertStruct(const TStructure *structure, TIntermSequence *newDeclarations)
699 {
700 ASSERT(mInnerPassRoot == nullptr);
701
702 ASSERT(mOuterPass.structMap.count(structure) != 0);
703 StructConversionData *structData = &mOuterPass.structMap[structure];
704
705 if (structData->convertedStruct)
706 {
707 return;
708 }
709
710 TFieldList *newFields = new TFieldList;
711 for (const TField *field : structure->fields())
712 {
713 newFields->push_back(convertField(field, newDeclarations));
714 }
715
716 // Create unique names for the converted structs. We can't leave them nameless and have
717 // a name autogenerated similar to temp variables, as nameless structs exist. A fake
718 // variable is created for the sole purpose of generating a temp name.
719 TVariable *newStructTypeName =
720 new TVariable(mSymbolTable, kEmptyImmutableString, StaticType::GetBasic<EbtUInt>(),
721 SymbolType::Empty);
722
723 TStructure *newStruct = new TStructure(mSymbolTable, newStructTypeName->name(), newFields,
724 SymbolType::AngleInternal);
725 TType *newType = new TType(newStruct, true);
726 TVariable *newStructVar =
727 new TVariable(mSymbolTable, kEmptyImmutableString, newType, SymbolType::Empty);
728
729 TIntermDeclaration *structDecl = new TIntermDeclaration;
730 structDecl->appendDeclarator(new TIntermSymbol(newStructVar));
731
732 newDeclarations->push_back(structDecl);
733
734 structData->convertedStruct = newStruct;
735 }
736
737 TField *convertField(const TField *field, TIntermSequence *newDeclarations)
738 {
739 ASSERT(mInnerPassRoot == nullptr);
740
741 TField *newField = nullptr;
742
743 const TType *fieldType = field->type();
744 TType *newType = nullptr;
745
746 if (fieldType->isStructureContainingMatrices())
747 {
748 // If the field is a struct instance, convert the struct and replace the field
749 // with an instance of the new struct.
750 const TStructure *fieldTypeStruct = fieldType->getStruct();
751 convertStruct(fieldTypeStruct, newDeclarations);
752
753 StructConversionData &structData = mOuterPass.structMap[fieldTypeStruct];
754 newType = new TType(structData.convertedStruct, false);
755 SetColumnMajor(newType);
756 CopyArraySizes(fieldType, newType);
757 }
758 else if (fieldType->isMatrix())
759 {
760 // If the field is a matrix, transpose the matrix and replace the field with
761 // that, removing the matrix packing qualifier.
762 newType = TransposeMatrixType(fieldType);
763 }
764
765 if (newType)
766 {
767 newField = new TField(newType, field->name(), field->line(), field->symbolType());
768 }
769 else
770 {
771 newField = DuplicateField(field);
772 }
773
774 return newField;
775 }
776
777 void determineAccess(TIntermNode *expression,
778 TIntermNode *accessor,
779 bool *isReadOut,
780 bool *isWriteOut)
781 {
782 // If passing to a function, look at whether the parameter is in, out or inout.
783 TIntermAggregate *functionCall = accessor->getAsAggregate();
784
785 if (functionCall)
786 {
787 TIntermSequence *arguments = functionCall->getSequence();
788 for (size_t argIndex = 0; argIndex < arguments->size(); ++argIndex)
789 {
790 if ((*arguments)[argIndex] == expression)
791 {
792 TQualifier qualifier = EvqIn;
793
794 // If the aggregate is not a function call, it's a constructor, and so every
795 // argument is an input.
796 const TFunction *function = functionCall->getFunction();
797 if (function)
798 {
799 const TVariable *param = function->getParam(argIndex);
800 qualifier = param->getType().getQualifier();
801 }
802
803 *isReadOut = qualifier != EvqOut;
804 *isWriteOut = qualifier == EvqOut || qualifier == EvqInOut;
805 break;
806 }
807 }
808 return;
809 }
810
811 TIntermBinary *assignment = accessor->getAsBinaryNode();
812 if (assignment && IsAssignment(assignment->getOp()))
813 {
814 // If expression is on the right of assignment, it's being read from.
815 *isReadOut = assignment->getRight() == expression;
816 // If it's on the left of assignment, it's being written to.
817 *isWriteOut = assignment->getLeft() == expression;
818 return;
819 }
820
821 // Any other usage is a read.
822 *isReadOut = true;
823 *isWriteOut = false;
824 }
825
826 void transformExpression(TIntermSymbol *symbol)
827 {
828 // Walk up the parent chain while the nodes are EOpIndex* (whether array indexing or struct
829 // field selection) or swizzle and construct the replacement expression. This traversal can
830 // lead to one of the following possibilities:
831 //
832 // - a.b[N].etc.s (struct, or struct array): copy function should be declared and used,
833 // - a.b[N].etc.M (matrix or matrix array): transpose() should be used,
834 // - a.b[N].etc.M[c] (a column): each element in column needs to be handled separately,
835 // - a.b[N].etc.M[c].yz (multiple elements): similar to whole column, but a subset of
836 // elements,
837 // - a.b[N].etc.M[c][r] (an element): single element to handle.
838 // - a.b[N].etc.x (not struct or matrix): not modified
839 //
840 // primaryIndex will contain c, if any. secondaryIndices will contain {0, ..., R-1}
841 // (if no [r] or swizzle), {r} (if [r]), or {1, 2} (corresponding to .yz) if any.
842 //
843 // In all cases, the base symbol is replaced. |baseExpression| will contain everything up
844 // to (and not including) the last index/swizzle operations, i.e. a.b[N].etc.s/M/x. Any
845 // non constant array subscript is assigned to a temp variable to avoid duplicating side
846 // effects.
847 //
848 // ---
849 //
850 // NOTE that due to the use of insertStatementsInParentBlock, cases like this will be
851 // mistranslated, and this bug is likely present in most transformations that use this
852 // feature:
853 //
854 // if (x == 1 && a.b[x = 2].etc.M = value)
855 //
856 // which will translate to:
857 //
858 // temp = (x = 2)
859 // if (x == 1 && a.b[temp].etc.M = transpose(value))
860 //
861 // See http://anglebug.com/3829.
862 //
863 TIntermTyped *baseExpression =
864 new TIntermSymbol(mInterfaceBlockMap->at(&symbol->variable()));
865 const TStructure *structure = nullptr;
866
867 TIntermNode *primaryIndex = nullptr;
868 TIntermSequence secondaryIndices;
869
870 // In some cases, it is necessary to prepend or append statements. Those are captured in
871 // |prependStatements| and |appendStatements|.
872 TIntermSequence prependStatements;
873 TIntermSequence appendStatements;
874
875 // If the expression is neither a struct or matrix, no modification is necessary.
876 // If it's a struct that doesn't have matrices, again there's no transformation necessary.
877 // If it's an interface block matrix field that didn't need to be transposed, no
878 // transpformation is necessary.
879 //
880 // In all these cases, |baseExpression| contains all of the original expression.
881 //
882 // If the starting symbol itself is a field of a nameless interface block, it needs
883 // conversion if we reach here.
884 bool requiresTransformation = !symbol->getType().isInterfaceBlock();
885
886 uint32_t accessorIndex = 0;
887 TIntermTyped *previousAncestor = symbol;
888 while (IsIndexNode(getAncestorNode(accessorIndex), previousAncestor))
889 {
890 TIntermTyped *ancestor = getAncestorNode(accessorIndex)->getAsTyped();
891 ASSERT(ancestor);
892
893 const TType &previousAncestorType = previousAncestor->getType();
894
895 TIntermSequence indices;
896 TOperator op = GetIndex(mSymbolTable, ancestor, &indices, &prependStatements);
897
898 bool opIsIndex = op == EOpIndexDirect || op == EOpIndexIndirect;
899 bool isArrayIndex = opIsIndex && previousAncestorType.isArray();
900 bool isMatrixIndex = opIsIndex && previousAncestorType.isMatrix();
901
902 // If it's a direct index in a matrix, it's the primary index.
903 bool isMatrixPrimarySubscript = isMatrixIndex && !isArrayIndex;
904 ASSERT(!isMatrixPrimarySubscript ||
905 (primaryIndex == nullptr && secondaryIndices.empty()));
906 // If primary index is seen and the ancestor is still an index, it must be a direct
907 // index as the secondary one. Note that if primaryIndex is set, there can only ever be
908 // one more parent of interest, and that's subscripting the second dimension.
909 bool isMatrixSecondarySubscript = primaryIndex != nullptr;
910 ASSERT(!isMatrixSecondarySubscript || (opIsIndex && !isArrayIndex));
911
912 if (requiresTransformation && isMatrixPrimarySubscript)
913 {
914 ASSERT(indices.size() == 1);
915 primaryIndex = indices.front();
916
917 // Default the secondary indices to include every row. If there's a secondary
918 // subscript provided, it will override this.
919 int rows = previousAncestorType.getRows();
920 for (int r = 0; r < rows; ++r)
921 {
922 secondaryIndices.push_back(CreateIndexNode(r));
923 }
924 }
925 else if (isMatrixSecondarySubscript)
926 {
927 ASSERT(requiresTransformation);
928
929 secondaryIndices = indices;
930
931 // Indices after this point are not interesting. There can't actually be any other
932 // index nodes other than desktop GLSL's swizzles on scalars, like M[1][2].yyy.
933 ++accessorIndex;
934 break;
935 }
936 else
937 {
938 // Replicate the expression otherwise.
939 baseExpression =
940 ReplicateIndexNode(mSymbolTable, ancestor, baseExpression, &indices);
941
942 const TType &ancestorType = ancestor->getType();
943 structure = ancestorType.getStruct();
944
945 requiresTransformation =
946 requiresTransformation ||
947 IsConvertedField(ancestor, mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn);
948
949 // If we reach a point where the expression is neither a matrix-containing struct
950 // nor a matrix, there's no transformation required. This can happen if we decend
951 // through a struct marked with row-major but arrive at a member that doesn't
952 // include a matrix.
953 if (!ancestorType.isMatrix() && !ancestorType.isStructureContainingMatrices())
954 {
955 requiresTransformation = false;
956 }
957 }
958
959 previousAncestor = ancestor;
960 ++accessorIndex;
961 }
962
963 TIntermNode *originalExpression =
964 accessorIndex == 0 ? symbol : getAncestorNode(accessorIndex - 1);
965 TIntermNode *accessor = getAncestorNode(accessorIndex);
966
967 // if accessor is EOpArrayLength, we don't need to perform any transformations either.
968 // Note that this only applies to unsized arrays, as the RemoveArrayLengthMethod()
969 // transformation would have removed this operation otherwise.
970 TIntermUnary *accessorAsUnary = accessor->getAsUnaryNode();
971 if (requiresTransformation && accessorAsUnary && accessorAsUnary->getOp() == EOpArrayLength)
972 {
973 ASSERT(accessorAsUnary->getOperand() == originalExpression);
974 ASSERT(accessorAsUnary->getOperand()->getType().isUnsizedArray());
975
976 requiresTransformation = false;
977
978 // We need to replace the whole expression including the EOpArrayLength, to avoid
979 // confusing the replacement code as the original and new expressions don't have the
980 // same type (one is the transpose of the other). This doesn't affect the .length()
981 // operation, so this replacement is ok, though it's not worth special-casing this in
982 // the node replacement algorithm.
983 //
984 // Note: the |if (!requiresTransformation)| immediately below will be entered after
985 // this.
986 originalExpression = accessor;
987 accessor = getAncestorNode(accessorIndex + 1);
988 baseExpression = new TIntermUnary(EOpArrayLength, baseExpression, nullptr);
989 }
990
991 if (!requiresTransformation)
992 {
993 ASSERT(primaryIndex == nullptr);
994 queueReplacementWithParent(accessor, originalExpression, baseExpression,
995 OriginalNode::IS_DROPPED);
996
997 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser *traverser = mOuterTraverser ? mOuterTraverser : this;
998 traverser->insertStatementsInParentBlock(prependStatements, appendStatements);
999 return;
1000 }
1001
1002 ASSERT(structure == nullptr || primaryIndex == nullptr);
1003 ASSERT(structure != nullptr || baseExpression->getType().isMatrix());
1004
1005 // At the end, we can determine if the expression is being read from or written to (or both,
1006 // if sent as an inout parameter to a function). For the sake of the transformation, the
1007 // left-hand side of operations like += can be treated as "written to", without necessarily
1008 // "read from".
1009 bool isRead = false;
1010 bool isWrite = false;
1011
1012 determineAccess(originalExpression, accessor, &isRead, &isWrite);
1013
1014 ASSERT(isRead || isWrite);
1015
1016 TIntermTyped *readExpression = nullptr;
1017 if (isRead)
1018 {
1019 readExpression = transformReadExpression(
1020 baseExpression, primaryIndex, &secondaryIndices, structure, &prependStatements);
1021
1022 // If both read from and written to (i.e. passed to inout parameter), store the
1023 // expression in a temp variable and pass that to the function.
1024 if (isWrite)
1025 {
1026 readExpression =
1027 CopyToTempVariable(mSymbolTable, readExpression, &prependStatements);
1028 }
1029
1030 // Replace the original expression with the transformed one. Read transformations
1031 // always generate a single expression that can be used in place of the original (as
1032 // oppposed to write transformations that can generate multiple statements).
1033 queueReplacementWithParent(accessor, originalExpression, readExpression,
1034 OriginalNode::IS_DROPPED);
1035 }
1036
1037 TIntermSequence postTransformPrependStatements;
1038 TIntermSequence *writeStatements = &appendStatements;
1039 TOperator assignmentOperator = EOpAssign;
1040
1041 if (isWrite)
1042 {
1043 TIntermTyped *valueExpression = readExpression;
1044
1045 if (!valueExpression)
1046 {
1047 // If there's already a read expression, this was an inout parameter and
1048 // |valueExpression| will contain the temp variable that was passed to the function
1049 // instead.
1050 //
1051 // If not, then the modification is either through being passed as an out parameter
1052 // to a function, or an assignment. In the former case, create a temp variable to
1053 // be passed to the function. In the latter case, create a temp variable that holds
1054 // the right hand side expression.
1055 //
1056 // In either case, use that temp value as the value to assign to |baseExpression|.
1057
1058 TVariable *temp =
1059 CreateTempVariable(mSymbolTable, &originalExpression->getAsTyped()->getType());
1060 TIntermDeclaration *tempDecl = nullptr;
1061
1062 valueExpression = new TIntermSymbol(temp);
1063
1064 TIntermBinary *assignment = accessor->getAsBinaryNode();
1065 if (assignment)
1066 {
1067 assignmentOperator = assignment->getOp();
1068 ASSERT(IsAssignment(assignmentOperator));
1069
1070 // We are converting the assignment to the left-hand side of an expression in
1071 // the form M=exp. A subexpression of exp itself could require a
1072 // transformation. This complicates things as there would be two replacements:
1073 //
1074 // - Replace M=exp with temp (because the return value of the assignment could
1075 // be used)
1076 // - Replace exp with exp2, where parent is M=exp
1077 //
1078 // The second replacement however is ineffective as the whole of M=exp is
1079 // already transformed. What's worse, M=exp is transformed without taking exp's
1080 // transformations into account. To address this issue, this same traverser is
1081 // called on the right-hand side expression, with a special flag such that it
1082 // only processes that expression.
1083 //
1084 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser *outerTraverser =
1085 mOuterTraverser ? mOuterTraverser : this;
1086 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser rhsTraverser(
1087 mSymbolTable, outerTraverser, mInterfaceBlockMap,
1088 mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn, mStructMapOut, mCopyFunctionDefinitionsOut,
1089 assignment);
1090 getRootNode()->traverse(&rhsTraverser);
1091 bool valid = rhsTraverser.updateTree(mCompiler, getRootNode());
1092 ASSERT(valid);
1093
1094 tempDecl = CreateTempInitDeclarationNode(temp, assignment->getRight());
1095
1096 // Replace the whole assignment expression with the right-hand side as a read
1097 // expression, in case the result of the assignment is used. For example, this
1098 // transforms:
1099 //
1100 // if ((M += exp) == X)
1101 // {
1102 // // use M
1103 // }
1104 //
1105 // to:
1106 //
1107 // temp = exp;
1108 // M += transform(temp);
1109 // if (transform(M) == X)
1110 // {
1111 // // use M
1112 // }
1113 //
1114 // Note that in this case the assignment to M must be prepended in the parent
1115 // block. In contrast, when sent to a function, the assignment to M should be
1116 // done after the current function call is done.
1117 //
1118 // If the read from M itself (to replace assigmnet) needs to generate extra
1119 // statements, they should be appended after the statements that write to M.
1120 // These statements are stored in postTransformPrependStatements and appended to
1121 // prependStatements in the end.
1122 //
1123 writeStatements = &prependStatements;
1124
1125 TIntermTyped *assignmentResultExpression = transformReadExpression(
1126 baseExpression->deepCopy(), primaryIndex, &secondaryIndices, structure,
1127 &postTransformPrependStatements);
1128
1129 // Replace the whole assignment, instead of just the right hand side.
1130 TIntermNode *accessorParent = getAncestorNode(accessorIndex + 1);
1131 queueReplacementWithParent(accessorParent, accessor, assignmentResultExpression,
1132 OriginalNode::IS_DROPPED);
1133 }
1134 else
1135 {
1136 tempDecl = CreateTempDeclarationNode(temp);
1137
1138 // Replace the write expression (a function call argument) with the temp
1139 // variable.
1140 queueReplacementWithParent(accessor, originalExpression, valueExpression,
1141 OriginalNode::IS_DROPPED);
1142 }
1143 prependStatements.push_back(tempDecl);
1144 }
1145
1146 if (isRead)
1147 {
1148 baseExpression = baseExpression->deepCopy();
1149 }
1150 transformWriteExpression(baseExpression, primaryIndex, &secondaryIndices, structure,
1151 valueExpression, assignmentOperator, writeStatements);
1152 }
1153
1154 prependStatements.insert(prependStatements.end(), postTransformPrependStatements.begin(),
1155 postTransformPrependStatements.end());
1156
1157 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser *traverser = mOuterTraverser ? mOuterTraverser : this;
1158 traverser->insertStatementsInParentBlock(prependStatements, appendStatements);
1159 }
1160
1161 TIntermTyped *transformReadExpression(TIntermTyped *baseExpression,
1162 TIntermNode *primaryIndex,
1163 TIntermSequence *secondaryIndices,
1164 const TStructure *structure,
1165 TIntermSequence *prependStatements)
1166 {
1167 const TType &baseExpressionType = baseExpression->getType();
1168
1169 if (structure)
1170 {
1171 ASSERT(primaryIndex == nullptr && secondaryIndices->empty());
1172 ASSERT(mStructMapOut->count(structure) != 0);
1173 ASSERT((*mStructMapOut)[structure].convertedStruct != nullptr);
1174
1175 // Declare copy-from-converted-to-original-struct function (if not already).
1176 declareStructCopyToOriginal(structure);
1177
1178 const TFunction *copyToOriginal = (*mStructMapOut)[structure].copyToOriginal;
1179
1180 if (baseExpressionType.isArray())
1181 {
1182 // If base expression is an array, transform every element.
1183 TransformArrayHelper transformHelper(baseExpression);
1184
1185 TIntermTyped *element = nullptr;
1186 while ((element = transformHelper.getNextElement(nullptr, nullptr)) != nullptr)
1187 {
1188 TIntermTyped *transformedElement =
1189 CreateStructCopyCall(copyToOriginal, element);
1190 transformHelper.accumulateForRead(mSymbolTable, transformedElement,
1191 prependStatements);
1192 }
1193 return transformHelper.constructReadTransformExpression();
1194 }
1195 else
1196 {
1197 // If not reading an array, the result is simply a call to this function with the
1198 // base expression.
1199 return CreateStructCopyCall(copyToOriginal, baseExpression);
1200 }
1201 }
1202
1203 // If not indexed, the result is transpose(exp)
1204 if (primaryIndex == nullptr)
1205 {
1206 ASSERT(secondaryIndices->empty());
1207
1208 if (baseExpressionType.isArray())
1209 {
1210 // If array, transpose every element.
1211 TransformArrayHelper transformHelper(baseExpression);
1212
1213 TIntermTyped *element = nullptr;
1214 while ((element = transformHelper.getNextElement(nullptr, nullptr)) != nullptr)
1215 {
1216 TIntermTyped *transformedElement = CreateTransposeCall(mSymbolTable, element);
1217 transformHelper.accumulateForRead(mSymbolTable, transformedElement,
1218 prependStatements);
1219 }
1220 return transformHelper.constructReadTransformExpression();
1221 }
1222 else
1223 {
1224 return CreateTransposeCall(mSymbolTable, baseExpression);
1225 }
1226 }
1227
1228 // If indexed the result is a vector (or just one element) where the primary and secondary
1229 // indices are swapped.
1230 ASSERT(!secondaryIndices->empty());
1231
1232 TOperator primaryIndexOp = GetIndexOp(primaryIndex);
1233 TIntermTyped *primaryIndexAsTyped = primaryIndex->getAsTyped();
1234
1235 TIntermSequence transposedColumn;
1236 for (TIntermNode *secondaryIndex : *secondaryIndices)
1237 {
1238 TOperator secondaryIndexOp = GetIndexOp(secondaryIndex);
1239 TIntermTyped *secondaryIndexAsTyped = secondaryIndex->getAsTyped();
1240
1241 TIntermBinary *colIndexed = new TIntermBinary(
1242 secondaryIndexOp, baseExpression->deepCopy(), secondaryIndexAsTyped->deepCopy());
1243 TIntermBinary *colRowIndexed =
1244 new TIntermBinary(primaryIndexOp, colIndexed, primaryIndexAsTyped->deepCopy());
1245
1246 transposedColumn.push_back(colRowIndexed);
1247 }
1248
1249 if (secondaryIndices->size() == 1)
1250 {
1251 // If only one element, return that directly.
1252 return transposedColumn.front()->getAsTyped();
1253 }
1254
1255 // Otherwise create a constructor with the appropriate dimension.
1256 TType *vecType = new TType(baseExpressionType.getBasicType(), secondaryIndices->size());
1257 return TIntermAggregate::CreateConstructor(*vecType, &transposedColumn);
1258 }
1259
1260 void transformWriteExpression(TIntermTyped *baseExpression,
1261 TIntermNode *primaryIndex,
1262 TIntermSequence *secondaryIndices,
1263 const TStructure *structure,
1264 TIntermTyped *valueExpression,
1265 TOperator assignmentOperator,
1266 TIntermSequence *writeStatements)
1267 {
1268 const TType &baseExpressionType = baseExpression->getType();
1269
1270 if (structure)
1271 {
1272 ASSERT(primaryIndex == nullptr && secondaryIndices->empty());
1273 ASSERT(mStructMapOut->count(structure) != 0);
1274 ASSERT((*mStructMapOut)[structure].convertedStruct != nullptr);
1275
1276 // Declare copy-to-converted-from-original-struct function (if not already).
1277 declareStructCopyFromOriginal(structure);
1278
1279 // The result is call to this function with the value expression assigned to base
1280 // expression.
1281 const TFunction *copyFromOriginal = (*mStructMapOut)[structure].copyFromOriginal;
1282
1283 if (baseExpressionType.isArray())
1284 {
1285 // If array, assign every element.
1286 TransformArrayHelper transformHelper(baseExpression);
1287
1288 TIntermTyped *element = nullptr;
1289 TIntermTyped *valueElement = nullptr;
1290 while ((element = transformHelper.getNextElement(valueExpression, &valueElement)) !=
1291 nullptr)
1292 {
1293 TIntermTyped *functionCall =
1294 CreateStructCopyCall(copyFromOriginal, valueElement);
1295 writeStatements->push_back(new TIntermBinary(EOpAssign, element, functionCall));
1296 }
1297 }
1298 else
1299 {
1300 TIntermTyped *functionCall =
1301 CreateStructCopyCall(copyFromOriginal, valueExpression->deepCopy());
1302 writeStatements->push_back(
1303 new TIntermBinary(EOpAssign, baseExpression, functionCall));
1304 }
1305
1306 return;
1307 }
1308
1309 // If not indexed, the result is transpose(exp)
1310 if (primaryIndex == nullptr)
1311 {
1312 ASSERT(secondaryIndices->empty());
1313
1314 if (baseExpressionType.isArray())
1315 {
1316 // If array, assign every element.
1317 TransformArrayHelper transformHelper(baseExpression);
1318
1319 TIntermTyped *element = nullptr;
1320 TIntermTyped *valueElement = nullptr;
1321 while ((element = transformHelper.getNextElement(valueExpression, &valueElement)) !=
1322 nullptr)
1323 {
1324 TIntermTyped *valueTransposed = CreateTransposeCall(mSymbolTable, valueElement);
1325 writeStatements->push_back(
1326 new TIntermBinary(EOpAssign, element, valueTransposed));
1327 }
1328 }
1329 else
1330 {
1331 TIntermTyped *valueTransposed =
1332 CreateTransposeCall(mSymbolTable, valueExpression->deepCopy());
1333 writeStatements->push_back(
1334 new TIntermBinary(assignmentOperator, baseExpression, valueTransposed));
1335 }
1336
1337 return;
1338 }
1339
1340 // If indexed, create one assignment per secondary index. If the right-hand side is a
1341 // scalar, it's used with every assignment. If it's a vector, the assignment is
1342 // per-component. The right-hand side cannot be a matrix as that would imply left-hand
1343 // side being a matrix too, which is covered above where |primaryIndex == nullptr|.
1344 ASSERT(!secondaryIndices->empty());
1345
1346 bool isValueExpressionScalar = valueExpression->getType().getNominalSize() == 1;
1347 ASSERT(isValueExpressionScalar || valueExpression->getType().getNominalSize() ==
1348 static_cast<int>(secondaryIndices->size()));
1349
1350 TOperator primaryIndexOp = GetIndexOp(primaryIndex);
1351 TIntermTyped *primaryIndexAsTyped = primaryIndex->getAsTyped();
1352
1353 for (TIntermNode *secondaryIndex : *secondaryIndices)
1354 {
1355 TOperator secondaryIndexOp = GetIndexOp(secondaryIndex);
1356 TIntermTyped *secondaryIndexAsTyped = secondaryIndex->getAsTyped();
1357
1358 TIntermBinary *colIndexed = new TIntermBinary(
1359 secondaryIndexOp, baseExpression->deepCopy(), secondaryIndexAsTyped->deepCopy());
1360 TIntermBinary *colRowIndexed =
1361 new TIntermBinary(primaryIndexOp, colIndexed, primaryIndexAsTyped->deepCopy());
1362
1363 TIntermTyped *valueExpressionIndexed = valueExpression->deepCopy();
1364 if (!isValueExpressionScalar)
1365 {
1366 valueExpressionIndexed = new TIntermBinary(secondaryIndexOp, valueExpressionIndexed,
1367 secondaryIndexAsTyped->deepCopy());
1368 }
1369
1370 writeStatements->push_back(
1371 new TIntermBinary(assignmentOperator, colRowIndexed, valueExpressionIndexed));
1372 }
1373 }
1374
1375 const TFunction *getCopyStructFieldFunction(const TType *fromFieldType,
1376 const TType *toFieldType,
1377 bool isCopyToOriginal)
1378 {
1379 ASSERT(fromFieldType->getStruct());
1380 ASSERT(toFieldType->getStruct());
1381
1382 // If copying from or to the original struct, the "to" field struct could require
1383 // conversion to or from the "from" field struct. |isCopyToOriginal| tells us if we
1384 // should expect to find toField or fromField in mStructMapOut, if true or false
1385 // respectively.
1386 const TFunction *fieldCopyFunction = nullptr;
1387 if (isCopyToOriginal)
1388 {
1389 const TStructure *toFieldStruct = toFieldType->getStruct();
1390
1391 auto iter = mStructMapOut->find(toFieldStruct);
1392 if (iter != mStructMapOut->end())
1393 {
1394 declareStructCopyToOriginal(toFieldStruct);
1395 fieldCopyFunction = iter->second.copyToOriginal;
1396 }
1397 }
1398 else
1399 {
1400 const TStructure *fromFieldStruct = fromFieldType->getStruct();
1401
1402 auto iter = mStructMapOut->find(fromFieldStruct);
1403 if (iter != mStructMapOut->end())
1404 {
1405 declareStructCopyFromOriginal(fromFieldStruct);
1406 fieldCopyFunction = iter->second.copyFromOriginal;
1407 }
1408 }
1409
1410 return fieldCopyFunction;
1411 }
1412
1413 void addFieldCopy(TIntermBlock *body,
1414 TIntermTyped *to,
1415 TIntermTyped *from,
1416 bool isCopyToOriginal)
1417 {
1418 const TType &fromType = from->getType();
1419 const TType &toType = to->getType();
1420
1421 TIntermTyped *rhs = from;
1422
1423 if (fromType.getStruct())
1424 {
1425 const TFunction *fieldCopyFunction =
1426 getCopyStructFieldFunction(&fromType, &toType, isCopyToOriginal);
1427
1428 if (fieldCopyFunction)
1429 {
1430 rhs = CreateStructCopyCall(fieldCopyFunction, from);
1431 }
1432 }
1433 else if (fromType.isMatrix())
1434 {
1435 rhs = CreateTransposeCall(mSymbolTable, from);
1436 }
1437
1438 body->appendStatement(new TIntermBinary(EOpAssign, to, rhs));
1439 }
1440
1441 TFunction *declareStructCopy(const TStructure *from,
1442 const TStructure *to,
1443 bool isCopyToOriginal)
1444 {
1445 TType *fromType = new TType(from, true);
1446 TType *toType = new TType(to, true);
1447
1448 // Create the parameter and return value variables.
1449 TVariable *fromVar = new TVariable(mSymbolTable, ImmutableString("from"), fromType,
1450 SymbolType::AngleInternal);
1451 TVariable *toVar =
1452 new TVariable(mSymbolTable, ImmutableString("to"), toType, SymbolType::AngleInternal);
1453
1454 TIntermSymbol *fromSymbol = new TIntermSymbol(fromVar);
1455 TIntermSymbol *toSymbol = new TIntermSymbol(toVar);
1456
1457 // Create the function body as statements are generated.
1458 TIntermBlock *body = new TIntermBlock;
1459
1460 // Declare the result variable.
1461 TIntermDeclaration *toDecl = new TIntermDeclaration();
1462 toDecl->appendDeclarator(toSymbol);
1463 body->appendStatement(toDecl);
1464
1465 // Iterate over fields of the struct and copy one by one, transposing the matrices. If a
1466 // struct is encountered that requires a transformation, this function is recursively
1467 // called. As a result, it is important that the copy functions are placed in the code in
1468 // order.
1469 const TFieldList &fromFields = from->fields();
1470 const TFieldList &toFields = to->fields();
1471 ASSERT(fromFields.size() == toFields.size());
1472
1473 for (size_t fieldIndex = 0; fieldIndex < fromFields.size(); ++fieldIndex)
1474 {
1475 TIntermTyped *fieldIndexNode = CreateIndexNode(static_cast<int>(fieldIndex));
1476
1477 TIntermTyped *fromField =
1478 new TIntermBinary(EOpIndexDirectStruct, fromSymbol->deepCopy(), fieldIndexNode);
1479 TIntermTyped *toField = new TIntermBinary(EOpIndexDirectStruct, toSymbol->deepCopy(),
1480 fieldIndexNode->deepCopy());
1481
1482 const TType *fromFieldType = fromFields[fieldIndex]->type();
1483 bool isStructOrMatrix = fromFieldType->getStruct() || fromFieldType->isMatrix();
1484
1485 if (fromFieldType->isArray() && isStructOrMatrix)
1486 {
1487 // If struct or matrix array, we need to copy element by element.
1488 TransformArrayHelper transformHelper(toField);
1489
1490 TIntermTyped *toElement = nullptr;
1491 TIntermTyped *fromElement = nullptr;
1492 while ((toElement = transformHelper.getNextElement(fromField, &fromElement)) !=
1493 nullptr)
1494 {
1495 addFieldCopy(body, toElement, fromElement, isCopyToOriginal);
1496 }
1497 }
1498 else
1499 {
1500 addFieldCopy(body, toField, fromField, isCopyToOriginal);
1501 }
1502 }
1503
1504 // Add return statement.
1505 body->appendStatement(new TIntermBranch(EOpReturn, toSymbol->deepCopy()));
1506
1507 // Declare the function
1508 TFunction *copyFunction = new TFunction(mSymbolTable, kEmptyImmutableString,
1509 SymbolType::AngleInternal, toType, true);
1510 copyFunction->addParameter(fromVar);
1511
1512 TIntermFunctionDefinition *functionDef =
1513 CreateInternalFunctionDefinitionNode(*copyFunction, body);
1514 mCopyFunctionDefinitionsOut->push_back(functionDef);
1515
1516 return copyFunction;
1517 }
1518
1519 void declareStructCopyFromOriginal(const TStructure *structure)
1520 {
1521 StructConversionData *structData = &(*mStructMapOut)[structure];
1522 if (structData->copyFromOriginal)
1523 {
1524 return;
1525 }
1526
1527 structData->copyFromOriginal =
1528 declareStructCopy(structure, structData->convertedStruct, false);
1529 }
1530
1531 void declareStructCopyToOriginal(const TStructure *structure)
1532 {
1533 StructConversionData *structData = &(*mStructMapOut)[structure];
1534 if (structData->copyToOriginal)
1535 {
1536 return;
1537 }
1538
1539 structData->copyToOriginal =
1540 declareStructCopy(structData->convertedStruct, structure, true);
1541 }
1542
1543 TCompiler *mCompiler;
1544
1545 // This traverser can call itself to transform a subexpression before moving on. However, it
1546 // needs to accumulate conversion functions in inner passes. The fields below marked with Out
1547 // or In are inherited from the outer pass (for inner passes), or point to storage fields in
1548 // mOuterPass (for the outer pass). The latter should not be used by the inner passes as they
1549 // would be empty, so they are placed inside a struct to make them explicit.
1550 struct
1551 {
1552 StructMap structMap;
1553 InterfaceBlockMap interfaceBlockMap;
1554 InterfaceBlockFieldConverted interfaceBlockFieldConverted;
1555 TIntermSequence copyFunctionDefinitions;
1556 } mOuterPass;
1557
1558 // A map from structures with matrices to their converted version.
1559 StructMap *mStructMapOut;
1560 // A map from interface block instances with row-major matrices to their converted variable. If
1561 // an interface block is nameless, its fields are placed in this map instead. When a variable
1562 // in this map is encountered, it signals the start of an expression that my need conversion,
1563 // which is either "interfaceBlock.field..." or "field..." if nameless.
1564 InterfaceBlockMap *mInterfaceBlockMap;
1565 // A map from interface block fields to whether they need to be converted. If a field was
1566 // already column-major, it shouldn't be transposed.
1567 const InterfaceBlockFieldConverted &mInterfaceBlockFieldConvertedIn;
1568
1569 TIntermSequence *mCopyFunctionDefinitionsOut;
1570
1571 // If set, it's an inner pass and this will point to the outer pass traverser. All statement
1572 // insertions are stored in the outer traverser and applied at once in the end. This prevents
1573 // the inner passes from adding statements which invalidates the outer traverser's statement
1574 // position tracking.
1575 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser *mOuterTraverser;
1576
1577 // If set, it's an inner pass that should only process the right-hand side of this particular
1578 // node.
1579 TIntermBinary *mInnerPassRoot;
1580 bool mIsProcessingInnerPassSubtree;
1581};
1582
1583} // anonymous namespace
1584
1585bool RewriteRowMajorMatrices(TCompiler *compiler, TIntermBlock *root, TSymbolTable *symbolTable)
1586{
1587 RewriteRowMajorMatricesTraverser traverser(compiler, symbolTable);
1588 root->traverse(&traverser);
1589 if (!traverser.updateTree(compiler, root))
1590 {
1591 return false;
1592 }
1593
1594 size_t firstFunctionIndex = FindFirstFunctionDefinitionIndex(root);
1595 root->insertChildNodes(firstFunctionIndex, *traverser.getStructCopyFunctions());
1596
1597 return compiler->validateAST(root);
1598}
1599} // namespace sh
